info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, including the following county, Litchfield and western Massachusetts, including the following county, Berkshire. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Torrington, Thomaston, New Hartford, Litchfield, Sandisfield, Northwest Harwinton, Winsted, New Hartford Center, Terryville, Oakville, Woodbury Center, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton, Barkhamsted, Bethlehem, Morris, Colebrook and Bantam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
